meanings.definition: Excessive or exaggerated promotion or publicity.
meanings.sent1: The superhype surrounding the new movie made everyone excited to see it.
meanings.sent2: The company's superhype for their latest product led to increased sales.
meanings.sent3: The superhype for the school play was so intense that even the teachers were talking about it.
meanings.sent4: The superhype around the concert made it seem like a once-in-a-lifetime event.
meanings.sent5: The superhype of the event was so overwhelming that people lined up hours before it started.

meanings.definition: To promote or publicize (something) in an excessive or exaggerated way.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to superhype their new product to attract more customers.
meanings.sent2: The marketing team superhyped the event to create buzz in the community.
meanings.sent3: The actor superhyped his upcoming movie by sharing behind-the-scenes photos on social media.
meanings.sent4: The politician superhyped his achievements during the campaign speech.
meanings.sent5: The singer superhyped her new album release with exclusive interviews and teasers.
